title: The Lord Digbies designe to betray Abingdon carryed on for divers vveeks by an intercourse of letters. Which are here published for the satisfaction of all men, by Sergeant Major Generall Brown. Together with the cipher which the Lord Digby sent him for that purpose.
author: Browne, Richard, Sir, 1602?-1669.
publisher: printed for Laurence Blaiklock, and are to be sold at the signe of the Sugar-loaf at Temple-Bar,
notes: Consists of letters by Sir Richard Browne, Nathaniel Bernard, and George Digby, Earl of Bristol, with commentary by Browne.
The publication year is given according to Lady Day dating.
The first leaf bears an order to print.
Quires B and C are each in two settings: B2r signature-mark "B" is under (1) "men" or (2) "some"; C1r last line has (1) "messenger" or (2) "Messenger".
Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
